document.docAuthor: Liu, Tengteng, Wang, Shuxia & Li, Houhun
document.docTitle: Argyresthia (Argyresthia) grammosacca Liu, Wang & Li, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
34.
Argyresthia ( Argyresthia ) grammosacca
,
sp. nov.
( Figs. 43 , 79 , 112 , 168 , 224 , 272 )

Description. Adult ( Figs. 43 , 79 ) wingspan 12.0 mm. Head white, face tinged with yellowish white. Labial palpus yellowish white, mixed with grayish fuscous laterally. Antenna with scape white, pecten yellowish fuscous; flagellum white, ringed with blackish fuscous. Foreleg black on inner surface, tibia dotted with black at basal 1/3 and 2/3 on outer surface, tarsus black on distal four tarsomeres, remainder creamy white; midleg mostly creamy white, femur and distal part of tibia tinged with blackish gray; hindleg mostly creamy white, distal half of tibia blackish gray on outer surface, first tarsomere blackish gray on outer surface, other tarsomeres mixed with blackish gray on outer surface. Thorax white; tegula golden fuscous. Forewing ratio 4.0; blackish gray, grayish fuscous towards base; costa with several transverse white striae on basal 3/5, black spot at basal 2/5 and 3/5, white spot at distal 1/5; black suffusion near distal end of cell; dorsal band white, extending to near tornus, suffused with gray scales distally; dorsal spot black, broadly rectangular, from before middle of wing extending straight to middle of cell, or sometimes obliquely outwards to before 2/5 of costa; cilia black basally, gray medially, blackish fuscous distally, white at costal white spots, gray near tornus. Hindwing and cilia gray.

Male genitalia ( Figs. 112 , 168 , 224 ): Tuba analis equal to width of valva in length. Socius covered with 15–16 scale-like setae, posterior margin straight, bearing two long setae ( Fig. 224 ). Gnathos inflated distally, with 6̄12 long thick setae apically. Valva widest in basal 1/3, dorsal margin nearly straight; sparsely covered with a clump of thick setae in disc near ventral margin, with a few similar setae on distal area. Saccus shorter than width of valva, with distal 3/5 narrowed, linear. Phallus nearly straight, 4.5 times as long as width of valva ( Fig. 168 ). Second sternite with 10̄12 micro-setae in each row; eighth sternite V or Y-shaped. Coremata present.

Female genitalia ( Fig. 272 ): Ovipositor 3.2 times as long as eighth segment. Anterior apophysis 2/3 length of posterior apophysis, bifurcate at middle, branches fused, forming ventral margin of ostium bursae. Lamella postvaginalis triangular. Antrum funnel-shaped or slightly tubular, half length of eighth segment. Ductus bursae spinulate before and near opening of ductus seminalis; ductus seminalis originating from middle of ductus bursae. Corpus bursae oval, with dense micro-denticles; signum with basal plate band-shaped, horns short, widest at base and narrowed apically, slightly curved before apex, overall somewhat trapezoidal, anterior margin slightly convex medially.

1♀ (without hindwings and abdomen), Mt. Xinglong ( 35.80°N , 104.07°E ), Yuzhong County , Gansu Province ,

2000 m

;

12.vii.2010
, leg. Haiyan Bai and Linlin Yang
.

Distribution. China ( Gansu , Henan ,
Inner Mongolia
, Ningxia , Qinghai , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan ).

Diagnosis. This new species is superficially similar to
A. ( A. ) spinosella Stainton, 1849
. It can be separated by the socius straight on the posterior margin and the saccus with distal 3/5 apparently narrowed and linear in the male genitalia; and by the triangular lamella postvaginalis in the female genitalia. In
A. ( A. ) spinosella
, the socius is protruded posteriorly and the saccus is subtriangular in the male genitalia; and the lamella postvaginalis is nearly linear in the female genitalia.
Argyresthia ( A. ) grammosacca
is similar to
A. ( A. ) campylotropa
,
sp. nov.
in the male genitalia, and the differences between them are given under the latter species.

Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Greek prefix gramm -, meaning linear, and the term saccus, referring to the saccus with its distal part linear as compared to its congener
A. ( A. ) spinosella
.
